item.title: Sandworm: a timeline of hacking
item.description: The book In Andy Greenburg’s latest book, Sandworm: A New Era of Cyberwar and the Hunt for the Kremlin’s Most Dangerous Hackers, he talks about the exploits of the eponymous Russian hacker group and their significance. The book is split into six parts – Emergence, Origin, Evolution, Apotheosis, Identity, Lessons – with the main Sandworm narrative in the three parts: Emergence, Evolution, Apotheosis. We can deduce from this that Greenburg spends as much time on the context of Sandworm as on the group itself, and indeed in his own words:
